author: Grimms
text: When old Mr Fox was dead, the wolf came as a suitor, and knocked at the door, and the cat who was servant to Mrs Fox, opened it for him.

author: Grimms
text: The wolf greeted her, and said:

author: Grimms
text: "Good day, Mrs Cat of Kehrewit, How comes it that alone you sit?

author: Grimms
text: What are you making good?"

author: Grimms
text: The cat replied:

author: Grimms
text: "In milk I"m breaking bread so sweet, Will you be my guest, and eat?"

author: Grimms
text: "No, thank you, Mrs Cat," answered the wolf.

author: Grimms
text: "Is Mrs Fox not at home?"

author: Grimms
text: The cat said:

author: Grimms
text: "She sits upstairs in her room, Bewailing her sorrowful doom, Bewailing her trouble so sore, For old Mr Fox is no more."

author: Grimms
text: The wolf answered:

author: Grimms
text: "If she"s in want of a husband now, Then will it please her to step below?"

author: Grimms
text: The cat runs quickly up the stair, And lets her tail fly here and there, Until she comes to the parlour door.

author: Grimms
text: With her five gold rings at the door she knocks: "Are you within, good Mistress Fox?

author: Grimms
text: If you"re in want of a husband now, Then will it please you to step below?

author: Grimms
text: Mrs Fox asked: "Has the gentleman red stockings on, and has he a pointed mouth?"

author: Grimms
text: "No," answered the cat.

author: Grimms
text: "Then he won"t do for me."

author: Grimms
text: When the wolf was gone, came a dog, a stag, a hare, a bear, a lion, and all the beasts of the forest, one after the other.

author: Grimms
text: But one of the good qualities which old Mr Fox had possessed, was always lacking, and the cat had continually to send the suitors away.

author: Grimms
text: At length came a young fox.

author: Grimms
text: Then Mrs Fox said: "Has the gentleman red stockings on, and has a little pointed mouth?"

author: Grimms
text: "Yes," said the cat, "he has."

author: Grimms
text: "Then let him come upstairs," said Mrs Fox, and ordered the servant to prepare the wedding feast.

author: Grimms
text: "Sweep me the room as clean as you can, Up with the window, fling out my old man!

author: Grimms
text: For many a fine fat mouse he brought, Yet of his wife he never thought, But ate up every one he caught."

author: Grimms
text: Then the wedding was solemnized with young Mr Fox, and there was much rejoicing and dancing; and if they have not left off, they are dancing still.
